Para Melconian, “no hay condición objetiva” para levantar el cepo
06 Nov 2019 by Economía
El economista Carlos Melconian aseguró que “no hay ninguna condición objetiva que permita levantar” el cepo cambiario apenas asuma el presidente electo Alberto Fernández, el 10 de diciembre.
“La chance de levantarlo es cero, al margen de que por vocación (el peronismo) sea un espacio que comulga algo diferente al cambio libre y flotante”, sostuvo el expresidente del Banco Nación.
A su criterio, “el tipo de cambio libre y flotante es un punto de llegada, no de partida. Es una batalla que perdimos, retrocedimos al cepo y no hay ninguna condición objetiva que permita levantarlo”.
“No hay margen para ensayar un programa de estabilización definitivo y exitoso el 10 de diciembre de 2019”, insistió el economista, en declaraciones a la prensa.
“Todavía hay déficit fiscal, hay un programa con el FMI que está colgado, hay un tema de la deuda que Argentina no va a pagar, hay cepo, reservas insuficientes, etc.”, explicó.

For Melconian, "there is no objective condition" to raise the stocks
06 Nov 2019 by Economy
The economist Carlos Melconian said that "there is no objective condition to raise" the exchange rate as soon as President-elect Alberto Fernández assumes, on December 10.
"The chance of lifting it is zero, regardless of whether by vocation (Peronism) is a space that communicates something different from free and floating exchange," said the former president of the National Bank.
In his opinion, “the free and floating exchange rate is a point of arrival, not of departure. It is a battle we lost, we retreated to the stocks and there is no objective condition that allows us to raise it.
"There is no room to rehearse a definitive and successful stabilization program on December 10, 2019," the economist insisted, in statements to the press.
"There is still a fiscal deficit, there is a program with the IMF that is hung up, there is a debt issue that Argentina will not pay, there is stocks, insufficient reserves, etc.," he explained.
